required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Prexasertib (LY2606368) in Combination With Ralimetinib in Participants With Advanced or Metastatic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Dose-Escalation Study of LY2606368 in Combination With Ralimetinib in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of the study drug prexasertib in combination with ralimetinib in participants with advanced or metastatic cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Prexasertib and Ralimetinib

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 3 Day 1 (28 Day Cycles)

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Prexasertib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 2 Day 1 (28 Day Cycles)
Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 2 Day 1 (28 Day Cycles)
Cycle 1 Day 1 through Cycle 2 Day 1 (28 Day Cycles)

secondary_outcome.measure: Best Overall Response (BOR): Percentage of Participants with Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), Stable Disease (SD), Progressive Disease (PD), or Not Evaluable (NE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to Earliest Objective Progression or Start of New Anticancer Therapy (Estimated up to 32 Weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Control Rate (DCR): Percentage of Participants who Exhibit SD, CR or PR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Measured Progressive Disease (Estimated up to 32 Weeks)
Date of CR or PR to Date of Objective Progression or Death Due to Any Cause (Estimated up to 32 Weeks)
Baseline to Objective Progression or Death Due to Any Cause (Estimated Up to 32 Weeks)

arm_group.description: Prexasertib given intravenously (IV) and ralimetinib given orally.
Prexasertib given IV and ralimetinib given orally.
Prexasertib given IV and ralimetinib given orally.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced or metastatic cancer.
- Able to swallow tablets.
- For Part B, you will need to have colon cancer or non-small cell lung (NSCLC) cancer with KRAS and/or BRAF mutations.
- Discontinued all previous treatments for cancer and recovered from the acute effects from the therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active infection (fungal, viral, or bacterial).
- Active cancer in your brain or spinal cord.
- Acute or chronic leukemia.
- Serious heart condition.
- Disease that requires immunosuppressant therapy.
- Diagnosis of inflammatory bowel disease.
- Major small bowel resection that interferes with your body's ability to absorb the oral medicine.
- Participated in other clinical trials investigating prexasertib or ralimetinib.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Other pre-existing conditions or medical history which your doctor will explain to you.
